edu.umich.verdict.relation

Class ExactRelation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umich.verdict.relation.Relation
      • edu.umich.verdict.relation.ExactRelation
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregatedRelation, FilteredRelation, GroupedRelation, JoinedRelation, LimitedRelation, OrderedRelation, ProjectedRelation, SingleRelation

    public abstract class ExactRelation
extends Relation
    Base class for exact relations (and any relational operations on them).
    Author:
    Yongjoo Park

      • approxWith

      • findSample

        protected List<SampleGroup> findSample(Expr elem)
        Finds sets of samples that could be used for the table sources in a transformed approximate relation. Called on ProjectedRelation or AggregatedRelation, returns an empty set. Called on FilteredRelation, returns the result of its source. Called on JoinedRelation, combine the results of its two sources. Called on SingleRelation, finds a proper list of samples. Note that the return value's key (i.e., Set) holds a set of samples that point to all different relations. In other words, if this sql includes two tables, then the size of the set will be two, and the elements of the set will be the sample tables for those two tables. Multiple of such sets serve as candidates.
        Parameters:
        functions -
        Returns:
        A map from a candidate to [cost, sampling prob].

      • nBestSamples

        protected abstract List<ApproxRelation> nBestSamples(Expr elem,
                                                     int n)
                                              throws VerdictException
        Finds 'n' best ApproxRelation instances that can produce similar answers for aggregate expressions. This method is expected to be called by AggregatedRelation initially and propagate recursively to descendants to properly build ApproxRelation instances that reflect the structure of the current ExactRelation instance. One important characteristic is that the returned ApproxRelation instances must be able to used by an outer AggregatedRelation for producing properly adjusted answers. This means that the ApproxRelation returned by this method must be associated with sampling probability and include two extra meta columns, i.e., __vpart and __vprob. One possible exception to this rule is that the source relation is an AggregatedRelataion or an ProjectedRelation whose source is an AggregatedRelataion. This is because, in the aggregation process, __vprob becomes meaningless. In this case, the aggregated source relation must attach __vprob as an constant, and let the information known to outer relations when ApproxRelation.samplingProbabilityExprsFor(FuncExpr) is called. If a source relation is an groupby aggregated relation, the aggregated relation's source must be a universe sample.
        Parameters:
        elem -
        n -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        VerdictException

      • consolidate

        protected SamplePlan consolidate(List<List<SampleGroup>> candidates_list)
        Note that findSample method obtains candidate sample sets for every (aggregate) expression. This function checks if some of them can be computed using the same sample set. If doing so can save time, we compute them using the same sample set.
        Parameters:
        candidates_list -
        Returns:

      • allPrecedingGroupbys

        protected static org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair<List<Expr>,ExactRelation> allPrecedingGroupbys(ExactRelation r)
        Parameters:
        relation - Starts to collect from this relation
        Returns:
        All found groupby expressions and the first relation that is not a GroupedRelation.
